messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: How to start unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: Adriana There is a great group not far from you. We meet weekly in Long Beach http://dragontree.vilter.us/ and if you are lucky Pam Sorooshian
messages.messageBody:
Adriana

There is a great group not far from you. We meet weekly in Long Beach
http://dragontree.vilter.us/ and if you are lucky Pam Sorooshian
http://www.sandradodd.com/pamsorooshian (a member of this list) will be
speaking. I haven't been in the last month but she was speaking weekly
prior to that. I've learned so much from being exposed to her talks that
I'm sure I haven't thanked her nearly enough. Thanks again Pam. The IRL
presentation of information and the sharing within the group at a park is
the perfect format for me to absorb information that I would have
ignored/missed in print. There are some other groups around but DT is the
"go to" group imho.

We are down at the southern tip of OC and find the 45m drive well worth the
effort.

Hope you find the irl support you are looking for. There are plenty of non
USing groups that are USing friendly that are around when you are ready.
Feel free to email me off list if you can't find them via yahoogroups or
google.

BTW I have a sister, now 21, who went to the Waldorf School of OC (I think
that's the name) through 4th grade. We considered Journey School, the
Waldorf inspired charter here in South County, when ds K aged. It was not a
good fit for him much to my mothers disapointment.

~JennB
PS I'm a newbie to this list but not to USing.

messages.msgSnippet: Hey Adriana, I live in Laguna Niguel (15 min south) and am trying to move to Costa Mesa (15 min north)! We are not yet active in any groups since my little one
messages.messageBody:
Hey Adriana,

I live in Laguna Niguel (15 min south) and am trying to move to Costa Mesa (15 min north)! We are not yet active in any groups since my little one is only 21 months and we are trying to move to a different part of the county, but I have can probably point you towards some local folks. I'll send you a private message with some links later or tomorrow when I am not typing while nursing. How old is your kiddo?

Alex
mama to Katya

messages.subject: Re: How to start unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: ... You d need to know the *homeschooling* laws for where you live - they vary by state (and in some places, by school district). Unschooling, legally, is the
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "kasik56" <kasik56@...> wrote:
>
> Hello,
> I am now at the stage of withdrawing my child from the Waldorf school
> and I don't see any other option but unschooling.
> Please help me get started, I don't have that clarity and vision of
> how, what, what's legal or not . I have a general idea of unschooling
> , read several books but I feel overwhelmed with taking that adventure
> on my own( no community).
> Thank you in advance. Adriana
>
You'd need to know the *homeschooling* laws for where you live - they
vary by state (and in some places, by school district). Unschooling,
legally, is the same entity as homeschooling. So, if you need to file
paperwork to homeschool, file paperwork. Whatever is needed, no more.

Then take a LONG vacation. Seriously. Pretend summer vacation started
way early. What would you do? Go to the park? Visit a children's
museum? Snuggle up cozy with cocoa and a favorite movie? Do it. Don't
even THINK about school for at least as many months as your child has
been in school. Don't think about "subjects" like math or spelling.
Think back to when your child was 3 years old - you were living and
learning together hand over fist every day *without* subjects or
school. Live like that again.

--Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] How to start unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: Adriana, Where do you live?  I bet there s a community nearby that you don t know about!   ~Kelly Kelly Lovejoy Live as if you were to die tomorrow.

Where do you live? 




I bet there's a community nearby that you don't know about! <g>


 ~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
"Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." ~Gandhi


-----Original Message-----
From: kasik56 <kasik56@...>








Hello,
I am now at the stage of withdrawing my child from the Waldorf school
and I don't see any other option but unschooling.
Please help me get started, I don't have that clarity and vision of
how, what, what's legal or not . I have a general idea of unschooling
, read several books but I feel overwhelmed with taking that adventure
on my own( no community).
Thank you in advance. Adriana

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] How to start unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: Where do you live, Adriana?  What led you to withdraw your child from the Waldorf school?  (I am a former Waldorf homeschooling mom, now happily unschooling!)
messages.messageBody:
Where do you live, Adriana? What led you to withdraw your child from the Waldorf school? (I am a former Waldorf homeschooling mom, now happily unschooling!)
You're unschooling right now. It's the belief that we're learning all the time! What books have you read?

~Melissa, in MD :)

----- Original Message -----
From: kasik56
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, February 24, 2009 1:05 PM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] How to start unschooling?


Hello,
I am now at the stage of withdrawing my child from the Waldorf school
and I don't see any other option but unschooling.
Please help me get started, I don't have that clarity and vision of
how, what, what's legal or not . I have a general idea of unschooling
, read several books but I feel overwhelmed with taking that adventure
on my own( no community).
Thank you in advance. Adriana

Hello,
I am now at the stage of withdrawing my child from the Waldorf school
and I don't see any other option but unschooling.
Please help me get started, I don't have that clarity and vision of
how, what, what's legal or not . I have a general idea of unschooling
, read several books but I feel overwhelmed with taking that adventure
on my own( no community).
Thank you in advance. Adriana
